units.title: Organoid derivation and maintenance
units.text: Organoids were derived and maintained according to previously published culture conditions10.
units.rationale: Establishes the baseline culture conditions for the organoids.

units.title: Cytokine treatment: organoid dissociation and reseeding
units.text: For the cytokine treatments, organoids were dissociated into five- to ten-cell fragments using TrypLE (Invitrogen) and reseeded in Matrigel.
units.rationale: Prepares organoids for cytokine exposure by creating small fragments and embedding them.

units.title: Cytokine treatment: medium supplementation
units.text: After 6 days, organoids were treated for 6 days by supplementing the culture medium with 50 ng ml−1 TNF and 200 ng ml−1 RANKL (Acro Biosystems) for TNF treatment28 or with 400 ng ml−1 IL-4 and 40 ng ml−1 IL-13 (Acro Biosy
units.rationale: Applies specific cytokine cocktails to modulate organoid signaling pathways.

units.title: Organoid recovery: Cell Recovery Solution incubation
units.text: First, culture medium was removed and organoids were incubated in Cell Recovery Solution (Corning) for 40 min at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Dissociates organoids from the matrix to enable downstream processing.

units.title: Organoid transfer to BSA-coated tubes
units.text: Next, organoids were transferred to 1% bovine serum albumin (BSA)-coated Pseudo-bulk analysis tubes using HBSS–1% BSA buffer while pipetting thoroughly to f
units.rationale: Moves organoids into a low‑adhesion environment for subsequent analysis.

units.title: scRNA-seq data normalization
units.text:
For each sample, the raw counts were normalized to a total count of 10,000 and then log-transformed.
From these normalized counts, the top 3,000 highly variable genes were identified using the default settings in Scanpy.
units.rationale: Standardizes sequencing depth across samples before downstream analysis.
